text: Val de Drôme is a commune. It is found in the region Normandy in the Calvados department in the northwest of France. The municipality was created on 1 January 2017 and consists of the former communes of Sept-Vents (the seat), Dampierre, La Lande-sur-Drôme and Saint-Jean-des-Essartiers.Arrêté préfectoral 26 September 2016 == Related pages == * Communes of the Calvados department == References == Category:2017 establishments in France Category:Communes in Calvados
title: Val de Drôme
